!MESSAGE Authentication error: com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: Auth fail
*** Bug 61037 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I get this everytime after startup either due to quick diff or when I sync my
workspace (see log below).

Q: This gets reported against a project (An error occurred refreshing
/jdt-ui-home: Authentication error: ...) Do I have to resync my whole workspace
when I get this message or only that project? How much of the synchronization is
done?

!MESSAGE Authentication error: com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: Auth fail
*** Bug 61698 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I just got this as well, on my first sync after moving to I200405290105.
It prompted me for my password, which I entered correctly, but I still got this
error logged.

It would be good to have an answer to Dani's question above.

We process each project individually, so if one fails the others will be
processed as well. The errors reported at the end indicate the projects that
didn't succeed. We should make this error message more descriptive and ensure
that we don't pollute the log/console with auth exceptions.

This is easy to reproduce, simply disconnect your network connection.

My log and console is filled with these exceptions, and in some cases they
appear as internal errors. 

java.net.UnknownHostException: dev.eclipse.org
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(PlainSocketImpl.java:153)
	at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:452)
	at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:402)
	at java.net.Socket.<init>(Socket.java:309)
	at java.net.Socket.<init>(Socket.java:124)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.util.Util$1.run(Util.java:186)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)



org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.CVSCommunicationException[0]:
java.net.UnknownHostException: dev.eclipse.org
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(PlainSocketImpl.java:153)
	at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:452)
	at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:402)
	at java.net.Socket.<init>(Socket.java:309)
	at java.net.Socket.<init>(Socket.java:124)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.util.Util$1.run(Util.java:186)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)

Quickdiff errors are now reported to the quick diff manager and shown to the
user and the synchronizing error message has been improved.

Basically, we will tell the user which projects succeeded and which ones failed
so that you don't have to re-sync everything.
